lightweight.translation[0].definitions[0: someone who has no importance or influence, or who does not have the ability to think deeply – used to show disapproval
lightweight.translation[0].definitions[1: a boxer who weighs less than 61.24 kilograms, and who is heavier than a featherweight but lighter than a welterweight
lightweight.translation[0].definitions[2: someone or something of less than average weight
lightweight.translation[1].definitions[0: a torch made from lightweight plastic
lightweight.translation[1].definitions[1: lightweight clothing or material is thin, so you can wear it in warm weather
lightweight.translation[1].definitions[2: showing a lack of serious thought – used to show disapproval
lightweight.translation[2].definitions[0: someone or something that has very little influence or importance
The furniture division had long been an industry lightweight.
lightweight.translation[3].definitions[1: lightweight books, television programmes etc are not serious and are made mainly to entertain people
The magazines contain a mix of information andlightweight entertainment.
